parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To pass by, depart, pass away. From para and ago; to lead near, i.e. to go along or away.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Birth. Feminine of a presumed derivative of the base of genea; birth.
